column1: Further,  in  Dayananda Vs.  Thalwatta  2001  2  SLR  72  this  Court  has  held

that  the  institution  of  proceedings  in  the  Magistrate's  Court 
in  terms  of quit

notice 
is  not a  determination  affecting legal  rights warranting the  issuance  of a
writ  of certiorari.  It was  open  for  the  petitioners  to  seek  to  quash  the  quit notice

by  way  of  certiorari  when 
the  determination  was  made  by 
the 
competent

authority or to move in 
revision at the conclusion of the Magistrate's  findings.
